title: Duolingo: Translating the Web with Millions of People

However, having a method that could accurately label images with words, several applications in practice, one of which most of you probably use most every day, which is image search.
So for example, you can go to Google and search for images of dog and you get back a lot of images of dogs.
Now the problem is that there's no computer program out there that can tell you whether an arbitrary image from the web contains the dog or not.

Typically work is by using filenames and HTML text, so if you search for dog, you go back a lot of images, name dog dot JPG.

It was a super fun game.

Some people played it more than 40 hours a week, but the idea of the game is that as people were playing it, they were also as a side effect, labeling images to improve image search and the way this game worked is it was a two player game.
So whenever you went to the website you get.
You got randomly paired with somebody else wanting to play the game, so it was you and a total stranger.

You are not allowed to communicate, and the goal of the game is for both you and your partner, who was a total stranger to type the exact same thing, giving that the only thing you two had in common is that you could both see the same image.
OK, so you could both be the same image you knew you could both be the same image and now you were told type whatever the other guys typing.

It turns out that what people did was type a lot of words related to the common image, and so basically both players were typing a lot of words related to the common image until one player ones words was equal to 1 player 2's words, they agreed that was the goal of the game and they got points.
